column1: L, Chris Wallace Nails Roy Blunt For GOP Hypocrisy On Deficits, David, 2021-04-04,
column2: Fox News host Chris Wallace on Sunday pressed a top Republican Sen. Roy Blunt (MO) over Republican opposition to President Joe Biden's infrastructure plan.
column3: We're talking about raising the corporate tax rate from 21% to 28 Wallace explained. "When President Trump came in it was 35 so it's still a tax cut from where it was in 2017."
column4: Wallace noted that Republicans want to block a tax increase for large corporations and instead pay for infrastructure with new taxes and fees on the average person.
column5: They're going to say you're protecting the fat cats and putting it all on the backs of the working class? the Fox News host explained.
column6: Blunt argued that the massive cut in corporate taxes under former President Donald Trump unleashed economic growth.
column7: Wallace pressed: "I haven't heard you say it today but some of your colleagues in the Republican Party are complaining about this is going to explode debt this is going to explode deficits."
column8: The Fox News host pointed out that under Trump's leadership the United States added over $3 trillion to the national debt before the pandemic while cutting taxes by $1.5 trillion.
column9: I guess the question is when I hear for instance Mitch McConnell talking about now about 'Well debt and deficits' hasn't the Republican Party haven't you lost your credibility on this issue?
column10: Blunt insisted that both Democrats and Republicans have bad records on controlling budget deficits. He then attacked Democrats over the latest infrastructure bill.
